opennlp.ccg.alignment
Class PhraseReader

java.lang.Object
  java.io.Reader
      java.io.BufferedReader
          java.io.LineNumberReader
              opennlp.ccg.alignment.PhraseReader
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, Readable
Direct Known Subclasses:
IdentifiedPhraseReader
public class PhraseReader
extends LineNumberReader

A phrase reader just reads line numbers, but does not search for phrase IDs. The line number of each phrase read is translated into the IndexBase provided at creation.

Author:
Scott Martin

Field Detail

LINE_NUMBER_BASE

public static final IndexBase LINE_NUMBER_BASE
The index base that starts numbering lines at 1.

See Also:
IndexBase.ONE
Constructor Detail

PhraseReader

public PhraseReader(Reader in)
Creates a phrase reader from the specified underlying reader and word index base for phrase numbers.

See Also:
PhraseReader(Reader, IndexBase), Alignments.DEFAULT_PHRASE_NUMBER_BASE

PhraseReader

public PhraseReader(Reader in,
                    IndexBase numberBase)
Creates a phrase reader.

Parameters:
numberBase - The target phrase numbering base. Phrases read from the underlying reader will have their numbers translated from the default to numberBase.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if numberBase is null.
See Also:
IndexBase.translate(Integer, IndexBase), readPhrase()
Method Detail

getNumberBase

public IndexBase getNumberBase()
The target number base that new phrase IDs will have their line numbers translated into.

See Also:
readPhrase()

getPhraseNumber

public Integer getPhraseNumber()
Gets the number last assigned to a phrase, translated into the specified number base. Note that this method may return a different result than LineNumberReader.getLineNumber() due to the base translation.

See Also:
IndexBase.translate(Integer, IndexBase)

readPhrase

public Phrase readPhrase()
                  throws IOException
Reads the next phrase from the underlying reader. The number is determined by translating the line number of the phrase into the target number base. The words in the phrase are tokenized by the Alignments.tokenize(String) method.

Returns:
null if no phrases can be read from the underlying reader.
Throws:
IOException
